issues.description: The Person.getBirthday() accessor in the template returns a String (birthday.toString()), while other code (PersonService.save(...) and the tests) expects getBirthday() to return a LocalDate and calls LocalDate methods (e.g., isAfter). This mismatch exists within the template itself and differs from the solution, where getBirthday() correctly returns LocalDate. As a result, the template will not compile/run: calls like person.getBirthday().isAfter(...) are invalid if getBirthday() returns String. This will block students from running tests or implementing the service logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the getter in the template Person class to return LocalDate (matching the field type) instead of String. For example: public LocalDate getBirthday() { return birthday; } This restores type consistency with PersonService and the tests. Ensure Jackson modules (already registered in tests/config) handle LocalDate serialization if needed, and consider a null-safe implementation if desired.
